description: We are Canada's largest paddle sports store and we love to paddle! We specialize in sales, rentals, lessons and repairs. Come visit us at our Toronto superstore.

reviews.title: Excellent customer service
text: I had picked out kayak (Wilderness Systems Pungo 125) at another store up North and called to order it at Complete Paddler to avoid a lengthy drive.  Dealt with Bella and she was awesome.  Took no time at all to order it, did not upsell me, and I arranged for delivery which was not very expensive.  Upon delivery, Bella even helped me carry my other big kayak across to another rack and offered to help with other things.  I will go here again for other purchases.

reviews.title: Disappointed
text: The woman I spoke to lied and was calculated.
The kayak I wanted wasn't discontinued and is available at other local store/s.
It was not replaced with the only model they had in stock.
Disappointing experience.

reviews.title: Great service
text: The staff at the Complete Paddler have been great. There were some manufacturer delays getting my boat, but they made sure I got on the water with a week long free rental. Great customer service from knowledgeable staff.
Thanks again,
Allan

reviews.title: Love this place and I will be returning
text: I was on the look for a new kayak, upon spending time doing some research found myself wanting the Perception Conduit 13.0 I ordered online , within 30 minutes my order was complete and I was on my way to Toronto to pick up my new kayak, they even threw in some free kayak Foam block for my car as I was not using the proper thing (Pool Noodles haha) got to TheCompletePaddler and my Kayak was sitting there waiting for me. reviews.title: Disgraceful treatment from owner Kelly McDowell
text: I purchased a paddle board and paddle from The Complete Paddler some time ago and wrote this the day after but forgot to post it. Just wanted to share my experience at The Complete Paddler.

I wanted to buy a paddle board as a gift but need it reasonably quickly. I called The Complete Paddler and the woman on the phone said they had 1 blow up board left and more were coming in a couple days.  I went in to take a look and the clerk (I believe it was Tyler) said they would be in in less than 2 weeks.  It was a time sensitive purchase (birthday gift) so I wanted to know for sure.  He said to find out I could call the supplier (Blu Wave).  I called and the company said they had shipped 2 boards the day before and it would only take a couple days.  I decided to buy the paddle board in advance to ensure I would have it. Now I needed a paddle but The Complete Paddler had none in stock that came in 3 pieces and would have to order them from Blu Wave.  I called Blu Wave back and they had them in stock but also had a cheaper one at 189 dollars.  I asked the owner Kelly McDowell about them and he recommended the 189 dollar paddle (a 3 piece adjustable carbon fibreglass paddle) but he would have to put in a special order the next day as they didnt stock that model.  I said sounds great and I paid for the board and paddle (1588 dollars) right then and left the store. I called Blue Wave back to tell them they would be getting an order from The Complete Paddler for that paddle and I needed it quickly. The Complete Paddler called 2 days later to say everything had arrived.

I went to the store to get my items and the owner Kelly McDowell approached me.  I thought it was to thank me for the business and send me on my way.  Nothing could be further from the truth.  He told me I had created a very BIG problem for him and his company.  Yah, seems like a huge problem. I just paid for a board and paddle after being in the store only 30 min.  He told me I could of cost him alot of extra money in shipping costs.  Really..... the paddle come in 3 pieces and weighs 810 grams.  He told me if I ever wanted to buy anything in his store again I could never contact the supplier.  I wouldn't of had to contact anyone if his staff knew anything about the products they were selling.  He was very aggressive and I didn't like his tone or his accusations he was making as they were complete nonsense. So now I am really annoyed.  Guess what Kelly.... I don't ever want to buy anything from your store again.  You were not doing me a favour selling me a paddle and board.  I was a customer and should be talked to in an appropriate respectful way.  I could of just order the paddle board somewhere else.  I would avoid going to The Complete Paddler and would encourage others to do the same.  Kelly McDowell is rude and disrespectful. I am not sure how they stay in business.  By the way Kelly McDowell ordered several of the paddles I wanted and the same one he suggested.  WHAT A HUGE PROBLEM I CAUSED.....

reviews.title: Bad customer service
text: Called to purchase a kayak and the gentleman on the phone was beyond rude. Went to MEC instead. My wife had previously tried arrange a rental of a canoe with her church group however they never returned a phone call. Total BS business. Save your frustration and go elsewhere.

reviews.title: Very Negative Experience
text: Extremely negative experience. Purchased a kayak and roof rack back at the beginning of the summer, roof rack was installed by employees of The Complete Paddler. Fast forward to our first time using the kayak, driving along the highway, we hear a big whoosh and...no more roof rack or kayak. We were very fortunate that the kayak flew over 3 lanes of traffic without striking anyone and landed on the inside shoulder of the highway. Much to our surprise the roof rack was not installed correctly, we thought that by leaving it to the experts to hook it up we were doing the right thing. Unfortunately we ended up being left with a damaged kayak and useless roof rack in pieces in addition to lots of stress. When this was brought to the attention of management at The Complete Paddler, there was no apology and it seemed like they were more interested in deflecting blame onto the manufacturer of the roof rack (Thule). They offered to replace the roof rack and re-install it which we accepted, we set an appointment to have it reinstalled but due to a miscommunication ended up being there on the wrong day, we were told the owner would give us a call to reschedule the appointment to install the rack. That was 3 weeks ago, having not heard anything since, we stopped in unannounced this past Sunday and picked up the rack, we'll have it installed elsewhere. Ultimately the experience was negative, there was no ownership of the issue taken, no apology, no customer service, and seemingly no understanding of the consequences this situation could have had, both on us personally, but also on the business, had the rack and kayak caused accident or injury, frankly it's a miracle it didn't.

reviews.title: Great selection and customer service!
text: I've been researching kayaks that can accommodate my dog while I'm out paddling and the CP website had one I thought would suit our needs, when I phoned to check on the measurements of the aft cargo well the person I spoke to (Charles) was knowledgeable and very helpful in measuring it for me and giving me some other info.
Today I went to the store to check it out and met a different salesperson, Andrew, who was again very knowledgeable and helpful.

The store has a huge variety of canoes and kayaks and related accessories, all at very good prices. The kayak I bought was under my budget so I treated myself to a nicer paddle than I had hoped for as well as a good CFD. (Canine Flotation Device)
The store also provides rentals which seem reasonable a well.
Very happy with my experience there!
